title: Build a Small Agile Development Team for a New App
description:
We are seeking an experienced React Native developer to build a hybrid mobile app for Gigspot, a music event ticketing platform connecting fans, artists, and venues. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in mobile development with a focus on hybrid frameworks, payment integrations, and user-friendly UI/UX. You will be responsible for creating a seamless, scalable, and high-performance application while collaborating with our existing web development efforts. If you have experience in developing event or marketplace apps, optimizing performance, and deploying to both iOS and Android, we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

Gigspot is a next-generation event ticketing platform designed to empower independent artists, venues, and fans. It provides a seamless experience for discovering live events, purchasing tickets, and managing performances, all while offering a fair and transparent marketplace for the live music industry. Unlike traditional ticketing platforms, Gigspot prioritizes accessibility, data-driven insights, and artist-first revenue models to create a thriving ecosystem where music professionals can connect, grow, and monetize their craft. With features like tier-based venue access, artist trend capture, personal artist/venue profiles with subscription based tiering systems, an Artist bank. Automated tour route and cost planning, auto-promo features (scheduled) promoting based on analytics, integrated ticket sales, and fan engagement tools, Gigspot aims to revolutionize how live music is booked, promoted, and experienced.

Gigspot ‚Äì Hybrid Mobile App Development
Job Title:
Full-Stack Mobile Developer (React Native) ‚Äì Event Ticketing & Artist Booking Platform

Project Overview:
Gigspot is a music event ticketing and booking platform designed to connect fans, artists, and venues. The platform will allow artists to self-book performances, manage tours, and receive payments, while venues can approve artist bookings and sell tickets directly to fans.

We are looking for an experienced React Native developer or full-stack team to build a hybrid mobile application for iOS and Android, along with an admin panel for platform management. The ideal candidate should have experience with event ticketing, payment integrations such as Stripe and PayPal, real-time data handling, and subscription models.

Scope of Work

Core Features (MVP ‚Äì Required for Initial Launch)
User authentication using Firebase/Auth0, including email/password login, social login, and password reset
User profiles for artists, venues, and fans with profile creation, editing, and verification system
Event listings and search functionality where users can browse and filter events by date, genre, and location
Artist self-booking system allowing artists to apply for events and venues to approve or reject requests
Ticket sales and payment processing through Stripe and PayPal, including automated revenue splitting between artists and venues
QR code ticketing and check-in system for venue entry
Push notifications using Firebase Cloud Messaging or OneSignal for event reminders, ticket confirmations, and booking updates
Basic admin panel for managing users, events, and financial transactions

Additional Features (Required for Full Platform Functionality)
Subscription tiers for artists and venues with paid membership options
Artist bank and revenue management to track earnings and request payouts
Automated tour planning system that suggests routes for artists
Auto-promotion tools to boost event visibility based on analytics and ticket demand
Social media integrations allowing event promotions across platforms like Facebook and Instagram

Technical Requirements
Frontend: React Native (Expo preferred)
Backend: Firebase (Firestore & Realtime Database) or Node.js with Express
Authentication: Firebase Auth or Auth0
Payments: Stripe API, PayPal SDK
Notifications: Firebase Cloud Messaging or OneSignal
Hosting & Deployment: Google Cloud (Firebase Hosting) or DigitalOcean
Version Control: GitHub or GitLab
Expected Deliverables
Fully functional hybrid mobile app for iOS and Android
Responsive admin panel for managing events and user activity
Secure payment system with automated revenue distribution
Scalable database structure to support growth
Deployment to App Store and Google Play
Budget and Timeline
Fixed Budget
Estimated Completion: 6‚Äì8 weeks
We are looking for a developer or a small team who can work efficiently within this budget while delivering a high-quality, functional MVP that can scale.

How to Apply
Please provide:

Your experience with event ticketing, booking platforms, or payment integrations
Links to past projects, especially mobile apps related to events or e-commerce
Your estimated timeline and approach to development
A breakdown of how you would structure the project milestones
We look forward to working with a dedicated developer who understands the event and music industry and can help bring Gigspot to life.

Our system consists of a tablet (Android) and an NFC reader (USB-connected).
The NFC reader follows a specific protocol (Multi-Message Protocol - MMP) documented by the bank.
The Flutter app needs to communicate with the NFC reader, send initialization commands, and process payments securely.
The bank‚Äôs payment processing API is already built-in, but correct command handling and response processing are required.

title: Developer needed to build a productivity app (ios android)
description:
The app aims to enhance productivity by reducing social media usage and encouraging focus through gamification. It combines elements from Forest app and Focus Tree, with a more streamlined interface. Users can block social media apps and engage in focus sessions using timers, stopwatches, or the Pomodoro technique. During these sessions, they plant virtual flowers on hexagonal plots in their garden. The hexagonal tiles represent honeycomb cells. Successful focus sessions earn users virtual coins, which can be used to unlock new flowers and background sounds. In-app purchases allow users to buy a necatr that triples their coin earnings.

The app includes social features similar to Instagram, where users can follow others, like and comment on their gardens, and invite friends to group planting sessions. If users lose focus, their flowers wither, but these can be removed using coins. The app displays daily motivational quotes upon opening.

The interface should be clean and intuitive, addressing the complexity issues found in similar apps. Users can track their progress daily, weekly, or monthly, viewing how their garden grows and diversifies. Rare flowers are more expensive to unlock.

Monetization options include a one-time purchase for lifetime access (approximately $9 USD) or a free version where users earn fewer coins per focus session. The paid version offers significantly more coins per session, enhancing the user's ability to unlock content.

The UI will be sent and ready after application.

title: Evidence Camera for capturing detailed layouts for telecommunications
description:
I am hoping to develop an app to document telecommunications infrastructure, such as manholes  and pits.

The app needs to prompt users to capture all required information, one photo at a time.

For example, the amount of ducts/pipes at each end of the pit/manhole.

On top of capturing this information in the photo, there will be check boxes to identify specific information.

On top of this, I would like the app to generate a sheet that documents and draws up that information, providing an overall pit/manhole layout.

I have sample sheets to show how these final sheets should look, and ideas on how we could capture this information accurately and easily.

The photos would need to save directly onto the phone being used, on the app, and potentially directly  onto a selected folder.

If you see the attached, you will see the required information and the samples of the Manhole Sheets.

I have ideas on how I would see this being a useful tool, but I'm open to suggestions.

Is it possible to take a photo of the end of a pit or manhole, then have options to select certain ducts on the pit wall, and flag them as a certain size, and also what remaining capacity they have?

If you look at the photo attached, you will see the side of a manhole with multiple ducts. These vary in size and remaining capacity.  

I imagine being able to click a duct on the photo, then click a check box that specifies a size and another that specifies a remaining capacity (what can still fit in the duct, with what's already there)

By doing this, the collected info can be generated onto a Manhole Sheet as per the attached example?

You would also need to be available for any further updates or issues into the future, and quite likely other similar projects.

title: Mobile App Developer (Flutter)
description:
Looking for mobile app developer Flutter and Dart. Experience with the backend would be a plus but not really required, as we are not looking for a jack of all trades.


PLEASE READ THE REQUIREMENT CAREFULLY BELOWResponsibilities
Develop a cross-platform mobile app using Flutter and Dart for iOS and Android.
Implement a check-in feature with an intuitive UI/UX design.
Integrate the app with a RESTful API for user authentication and data syncing.
Ensure the app is responsive, performant, and adheres to modern design standards.
Collaborate with our backend team to refine API endpoints and resolve integration issues.
Prepare the app for deployment to the Apple App Store and Google Play Store.

To help us evaluate your expertise as a Flutter developer, we require code samples from your past projects. Please note: We are not seeking confidential or proprietary information‚Äîjust examples that demonstrate your coding style and approach to building Flutter apps.

Question: How do you structure your widgets to ensure reusability and maintainability? Can you share an example from your code sample that shows how you break down a complex UI into smaller, reusable components (e.g., custom widgets for buttons, forms, or lists)?

Question: How do you manage and apply consistent styling across your Flutter app? Do you use Flutter‚Äôs theme system, define custom style classes, or rely on inline styles? Please provide an example from your code sample that illustrates how you handle styling for a specific screen or widget.

Question: How do you separate business logic from the UI in your Flutter apps? Do you use state management solutions like Provider, Riverpod, or BLoC? Please explain your approach with an example from your code sample, such as how you manage data flow between the UI and logic layers.

Question: If your code sample interacts with third-party APIs (e.g., external data sources or payment gateways), how do you organize and manage these integrations? Do you use specific packages (e.g., Dio, http) or architectural patterns (e.g., repository pattern)? Please provide an example of how API calls are structured and handled in your project.

Question: How do you organize and load assets such as images, fonts, or JSON files in your Flutter projects? Can you share an example from your code sample that demonstrates how you reference and use assets within the app (e.g., in widgets or configuration files)?

Question: How do you implement navigation and routing in your Flutter apps? Do you use named routes, generated routes, or routing packages like AutoRoute or GoRouter? Please provide an example from your code sample that shows your routing setup and how you handle navigation between screens.

Please ensure your code samples, snippets, or explanations address each of the questions above.
If you cannot share code, provide detailed descriptions of your approach for each area.
We are only interested in your general coding practices, not sensitive or proprietary logic.

title: Web App Developer for Travel Challenge Platform
description:
I am interested in developing a travel challenge web app, similar to Polarsteps.com, but focused on location-based challenges. The platform should allow users to complete geolocated challenges, earn points and badges, and see their ranking on a global leaderboard.
I understand that a web app is more cost-effective than a native mobile app (Android/iOS), but if possible, I would love to receive a quotation for both. My priority is to start with the web app, and if it gains traction, I would like to complement it with a mobile app.
üîπ Main Requirements:
‚úÖ User Registration/Login: Email, Google, Facebook, TikTok.
‚úÖ User Profile: Photo, name, counter of completed challenges, points, earned badges, and a summary of transportation methods used (car, bus, motorcycle, motorhome, bicycle, etc.).
‚úÖ Challenge System: A predefined list of challenges created by me or premium users, categorized by type and location.
‚úÖ Statistics Section: Similar to Polarsteps, users should be able to see personalized travel stats, including:
‚Ä¢ Number of challenges completed
‚Ä¢ % of each open challenge completed
‚Ä¢ Total locations visited
‚Ä¢ Distance traveled
‚Ä¢ Number of different transportation methods used
‚Ä¢ Most visited countries/cities
‚Ä¢ Etc.
‚úÖ Bulk Challenge Upload: I already have 1,000 challenge locations in Mexico, and the system must allow easy mass uploads, as the number of locations will continue to grow with each new country and challenge category I add. This should be considered in terms of database scalability and performance.
‚úÖ Challenge Proof Submission: Users must upload at least one photo per challenge location.
‚úÖ Automatic Approval: Challenges should be auto-approved, but with an option for manual moderation if necessary.
‚úÖ Points and Badges: Each destination will grant points, and upon reaching specific milestones, users will earn collectible badges.
‚úÖ Open Check-in: Users should be able to check in at any location on the map, but badges can only be earned by completing the predefined challenges.
‚úÖ Ranking and Gamification: A global and city-based leaderboard based on earned points.
‚úÖ Geolocated Challenges: Users must physically visit designated locations to complete challenges.
‚úÖ Challenges Without a Specific Location: I need the ability to add challenges that don‚Äôt require a fixed location, such as:
‚Ä¢ Trying a specific dish
‚Ä¢ Skydiving
‚Ä¢ Rafting
‚Ä¢ Hiking or trekking
‚úÖ Transport Mode Selection: Users should specify how they arrived at the location (car, bus, motorcycle, motorhome, bicycle, etc.).
‚úÖ Monetization:
‚Ä¢ Phase 1: Integration with AdSense and premium subscriptions.

title: Troubleshooting Verifone Payment SDK and NFC Scanner in Kotlin
description:
Technical Brief: Verifone Payment SDK and NFC Scanner Troubleshooting

Overview

We need immediate assistance from an experienced developer to diagnose and resolve state management and resource conflict issues between the Verifone Payment SDK (PSDK) and CardReaderQuantum NFC libraries in our existing Android-based POS application.

Key Tasks

Diagnose intermittent failures where the Verifone payment screen does not open when initiated.

Identify and fix conflicts between barcode scanner and NFC (CardReaderQuantum).

Investigate SDK initialisation issues, specifically resolving the STATUS_INITIALIZED -20 errors and payment session initiation failures.

Refactor and improve the payment SDK session and resource management.

Clearly document debugging steps, fixes applied, and final code solutions.

Technical Environment

Device: Verifone T650p (Android 8.1.0)

Libraries:

PaymentSDK (currently v3.62.2)

CardReaderQuantum (v5.335.2)

Platform: Android (Kotlin), Android Studio Koala, Gradle 8.x

Integration Mode: Semi-integration

Skills Required

Proven experience with Verifone PSDK integrations and troubleshooting.

Deep understanding of NFC, barcode scanner, and payment terminal resource management.

Strong Kotlin development skills with robust state management practices.

Capability to debug complex device logs and interpret Verifone SDK error codes.

Engagement Details

Immediate start required (remote acceptable; Australia preferred).

Short-term, hourly or daily rate negotiable based on experience and urgency.

Confidentiality (NDA) is mandatory.

Next Steps

Qualified candidates, please provide:

Availability to start immediately.

Hourly or daily rate.

Relevant previous Verifone integration experience.

description:

‚Ä¢ The Messages Tab takes 10+ seconds to load, even with minimal messages. This needs to be optimized for faster performance.

‚úîÔ∏è Proficient in FlutterFlow

‚úîÔ∏è Quick turnaround time (We need this done ASAP)

Reviews and ratings on business review websites

‚Ä¢ Responding to reviews: Businesses can respond to reviews publicly or privately.

Community Features:

Additional Features:

‚Ä¢ Mobile apps: Provide native apps for iOS and Android for on-the-go access.

‚Ä¢ Data insights: Provide businesses with data and analytics about their reviews and online presence.

For Users:

‚Ä¢ Review sentiment analysis: Analyze the sentiment of reviews to understand the emotional tone and provide users with deeper insights.
‚Ä¢ AI-powered recommendations: Recommend businesses based on a user's past reviews, location, and other preferences.
‚Ä¢ Lists and collections: Allow users to create and share their own curated lists of businesses (e.g., "Best date night spots" or "Kid-friendly restaurants").
‚Ä¢ Interactive forums and Q&A sections: Connect users with other reviewers and business owners to ask questions and share experiences.
‚Ä¢ Verification badges: Verify reviewers based on purchase history, social media, or other criteria to increase trust in reviews.

For Businesses:
‚Ä¢ Reputation management tools: Track reviews and analyze sentiment to identify trends and improve customer satisfaction.
‚Ä¢ Automated review requests: Trigger email or SMS review requests based on specific customer interactions.
‚Ä¢ Targeted advertising: Promote your business to specific user segments based on their review activity and preferences.
‚Ä¢ Direct booking integration: Allow users to book appointments or reservations directly through the platform.
‚Ä¢ Employee recognition: Highlight top-performing employees based on positive mentions in reviews.
‚Ä¢ Advanced analytics dashboard: Get detailed insights into review trends, customer demographics, and competitor analysis.
Additional Features:
‚Ä¢ Virtual tours and 360¬∞ images: Immerse users in the business experience with virtual tours and interactive photos.
‚Ä¢ Event listings and promotions: Allow businesses to post upcoming events and promotional offers.
‚Ä¢ Fact-checking and misinformation detection: Combat fake news and unreliable information in reviews.
‚Ä¢ Integration with other platforms: Integrate with booking platforms, delivery services, or social media for a seamless user experience.

title: Fix the error of the camera UVCAndroid library, UVCCamera
description:
We use UVCAndroid library to connect external camera. We can see and record video on different tablets and smartphones, but it is impossible and on tablets with a diagonal of 8.7 "this library does not work, black screen and when I start and finish recording the screen I see the error "The file has no video key frame"

we have tested this application - https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=net.usb.usby4&hl=en_US  and it also uses UVCAndroid library and it works on these tablets

tablets:
SAMSUNG Galaxy Tab A9 8.7‚Äù OS 14
Xiaomi Redmi Pad Se WiFi 8.7" OS 14
Samsung Galaxy Tab A7

You can use any USB camera and USB - Type C adapter for testing

We have investigated this problem a little and came to the conclusion:
Image Decodiong errors:
I First few bytes of frame: 0 0 0 0 0 0
E Invalid MJPEG frame SOI. size: 2688 SOI: 00

Valid MJPEG frame SOI. size: 336288 SOI: ffd8 - output to pixel 7 everything works here
Invalid MJPEG frame SOI. size: 1768 SOI: 00 - display on Samsung Galaxy Tab A7 Lite does not work here

other errors:
E set:488 set: Unset optional value from type CTA861_3
E set:488 set: Unset optional value from type SMPTE2086

https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/288828159?hl=ko&pli=1
https://community.infineon.com/t5/USB-superspeed-peripherals/CX3-UVC-video-streaming-OK-on-some-devices-but-failed-with-DMA-RESET-on-others/td-p/772075#

The MJPEG frame does not contain the correct SOI (Start of Image) ‚Äî the first two bytes, which should be 0xFF and 0xD8 respectively. In our case, SOI: 00 means that the first byte points to an incorrect SO

Sometimes a frame can be corrupted due to unstable communication or other factors that can corrupt its structure. It will be necessary to buffer several frames and only then pass them for decoding. This can help to assemble the frame from several parts.

Below I attach a screenshot of the error and the apk file of the UVCAndroid library, please run this apk on any device and connect any camera via type c. Then run this apk on an 8.7" tablet and try to play, you should see the error "The file has no video key frame".

It is necessary to fix this and enable UVCAndroid to record video on tablets with a diagonal of 8.7"

Fix the error of the camera UVCAndroid library, UVCCamera

you can check the code base here https://github.com/shiyinghan/UVCAndroid or use the archive in the attachment, or apk to get the error

title: iOS & Web App Developer Needed to Accelerate Development of RealMetric Analytics App
description:
About RealMetric Analytics & The App
RealMetric Analytics is a cutting-edge football data analytics company, providing elite clubs, scouts, and decision-makers with powerful insights through advanced player scouting, team analysis, and data-driven decision-making tools. See the full design here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zP2IW9a2RFE&t=1s

Our RealMetric Analytics App is a high-performance scouting and analytics platform designed to:
‚úÖ Deliver in-depth player insights based on advanced data analytics
‚úÖ Provide real-time player alerts and customized watchlists
‚úÖ Enable advanced scouting tools for identifying transfer opportunities
‚úÖ Offer team analysis and comparative performance metrics
‚úÖ Support clubs and agencies in making data-driven recruitment decisions

The app is already in active development, with 1/3 of the pages completed and live, but we need to accelerate progress significantly while maintaining top-tier quality.

Project Context & Scope
1Ô∏è‚É£ Designs Are Ready ‚Äì No New Work Required

The UI/UX for version 1.0 is fully finalized and implemented.
Version 2.0 designs are being finalized, and there is no need for major design work‚Äîonly small adjustments during development as needed.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Development Progress & Need for Speed

1/3 of the app is developed and live, but the current development speed is too slow.
We need a developer who can rapidly execute the remaining work while maintaining code quality.
Speedy delivery is the #1 priority for version 1.0 and 2.0.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Firebase Backend ‚Äì Infrastructure is Fully Set Up

The app is fully integrated with Firebase, so no backend work is required.
You‚Äôll be working primarily on front-end implementation and Firebase integration, ensuring seamless connectivity with Firestore, Authentication, Cloud Functions, and Firebase Storage.
The role requires collaboration with our current developer to maintain consistency and ensure smooth transitions.
4Ô∏è‚É£ App Platforms & Web Integration

The app is being developed for iOS (mobile & tablet) using Swift & SwiftUI.
We also want to integrate a web app version in the future, so experience with React, Next.js, or similar frameworks is a plus.
5Ô∏è‚É£ Quality & Speed are Critical

Version 1.0 is already halfway done‚Äîwe need faster progress without sacrificing quality.
Version 2.0 development will start soon, and we want a structured, high-quality approach.
6Ô∏è‚É£ Long-Term Opportunities

Beyond this project, we have ambitious plans for future updates (Version 3.0+), an Android version, and additional advanced scouting and analytics features.
If you deliver high-quality work efficiently, this could lead to a long-term role in shaping the future of our platform.
Who We‚Äôre Looking For
Required Skills & Experience
üîπ iOS Development (Swift, SwiftUI, Objective-C)
üîπ Strong experience integrating Firebase (Firestore, Authentication, Cloud Functions, Firebase Storage)
üîπ Experience with mobile UI/UX implementation based on pre-designed layouts
üîπ Ability to integrate Firebase APIs seamlessly with a mobile app
üîπ Familiarity with web app development (React, Next.js, or similar) is a plus
üîπ Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
üîπ Ability to work collaboratively with the existing developer
üîπ Efficient coding skills‚Äîwe need fast progress without compromising quality
üîπ Experience working in fast-paced, high-performance projects

Ideal Candidate
‚úÖ Can jump into an ongoing project and quickly pick up the work
‚úÖ Delivers fast results while ensuring top-tier quality
‚úÖ Comfortable working with pre-existing designs & Firebase backend
‚úÖ Takes ownership and proactively solves problems
‚úÖ Open to long-term collaboration for future updates & expansion

How to Apply
To be considered for this role, you must:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Confirm that you have read and fully understood this job description.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Explain how you would approach speeding up development while maintaining quality.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Provide examples of past iOS projects using Firebase you've worked on.
4Ô∏è‚É£ Share your experience working with an existing development team and collaborating on ongoing projects.

üö® Automated applications will NOT be considered. Only personalized applications that directly address the job details will be reviewed. Your application must be supplemented by your similar previous projects and a specific cover letter, explaining why you're the best candidate for this projectüö®

If you are ready to move fast, deliver high-quality code, and work on a cutting-edge football data platform, we want to hear from you! üöÄ

title: Experienced Mobile App Developer Needed for AI-Powered Expense Tracking App
description:
We are seeking a skilled mobile app developer to build a feature-rich expense tracking app tailored for the Chinese market. The app must seamlessly integrate with WeChat Pay and Alipay, automatically recording transactions (date, amount, merchant, time, etc.) when users make payments.

This app should support multiple account books, AI-powered categorization, advanced search, tagging, and collaborative expense management.

Key Features:

1. Payment Integration (WeChat Pay & Alipay)

‚úÖ Automatically logs transactions when users pay via WeChat Pay or Alipay.
‚úÖ Captures essential details: transaction date, amount, merchant, time, etc.
‚úÖ Ensures high accuracy in data retrieval and categorization.

2. Multiple Account Books & Sharing

‚úÖ Users can create multiple expense books (e.g., Personal, Business, Family).
‚úÖ Ability to share specific books with other users for collaborative tracking.

3. AI-Powered Auto-Categorization

‚úÖ AI automatically categorizes expenses into relevant spending categories.
‚úÖ Users can manually adjust categories if needed.

4. Smart Expense Input for Other Payment Methods

‚úÖ If a user pays with cash, bank transfer, credit card, the app automatically prompts them to enter transaction details immediately.

5. Import & Export Transactions

‚úÖ Users can import transactions (CSV, bank statements).
‚úÖ Export expense reports in Excel, PDF, or other formats.

6. AI-Based Insights & Reports

‚úÖ Visual reports & analytics on spending trends.
‚úÖ Optional AI-powered text analysis for financial insights and recommendations.

7. Search Transactions Feature üîç

‚úÖ Users can search transactions by:
‚Ä¢ Date
‚Ä¢ Merchant
‚Ä¢ Payment method
‚Ä¢ Amount
‚Ä¢ Notes
‚Ä¢ Tags

8. Tagging System üè∑Ô∏è

‚úÖ Users can add custom tags to transactions for easier tracking (e.g., #Business, #Food, #Shopping).
‚úÖ Filter transactions by tags for better expense organization.

9. Editable Transactions & Attachments

‚úÖ Users can edit transaction records anytime.
‚úÖ Attach receipts, invoices, or photos to transactions.

10. AI Customer Support
‚úÖ User contact customer support if needed

Technical Requirements:

üîπ Experience with WeChat Pay & Alipay API integration.
üîπ Proficiency in iOS & Android app development (React Native, Flutter, or Native).
üîπ Strong backend development skills (Node.js, Firebase, or other relevant stacks).
üîπ Experience with AI/ML for auto-categorization and text analysis.
üîπ Knowledge of data encryption & security best practices to protect financial data.
üîπ Familiarity with cloud storage & real-time database synchronization for shared expense books.

Additional Details:

üìå The app should have a user-friendly UI optimized for the Chinese market.
üìå Must comply with Chinese data privacy regulations.
üìå Developers with experience in Chinese fintech applications are preferred.

üöÄ If you have expertise in WeChat Pay & Alipay integration and are excited to develop an AI-powered finance app, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

üîπ Please provide:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Portfolio of similar projects
2Ô∏è‚É£ Your estimated timeline & budget proposal

title: IOS and Android APP Developers to work on a "Reservation System" for an online food delivery APP
description:
Seeking two (2) IOS and Android APP Developers to work with our Development Team to complete a Reservation System on our Customer APP for an online food delivery application.

Must have experience in building a reservation system and expertise in the areas listed below. Estimating work required to be up to ~80 manhours for each Application with work to be completed on an URGENT basis e.g. +/- 1 week.

For Android Developer:

### 1. **Knowledge and Skills:**
   - **Programming Languages:**
     - **Java** or **Kotlin** (Kotlin is now the preferred language for Android development).
   - **Android SDK (Software Development Kit):** Understanding of the Android SDK is essential to build apps.
   - **Android Studio:** The official IDE (Integrated Development Environment) for Android app development.
   - **XML (Extensible Markup Language):** Used for designing the UI (User Interface) of the app.
   - **API Integration:** Knowledge of working with APIs to handle data exchange between apps and external services.
   - **Version Control:** Familiarity with Git for managing code versioning and collaboration.

### 2. **Development Tools:**
   - **Android Studio:** A powerful IDE for building Android apps, providing features like a code editor, emulators, and debugging tools.
   - **Gradle:** A build automation tool used for managing dependencies, building, and packaging the app.
   - **Android Emulator:** For testing the app without needing a physical device.
   - **Firebase:** For backend services like authentication, databases, and cloud storage.

### 3. **Knowledge of Android Frameworks and Libraries:**
   - **Jetpack Components:** Libraries for UI and app architecture (e.g., LiveData, ViewModel, Navigation, Room, etc.).
   - **Material Design:** Google's design system for creating user-friendly, beautiful UIs.
   - **Retrofit/Volley:** Libraries for making HTTP requests.
   - **Room:** An SQLite database library to manage local data storage.

### 4. **App Architecture:**
   - **MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel)** or **MVP (Model-View-Presenter):** Popular architectural patterns in Android development.
   - **Clean Architecture:** Helps structure code in a way that's maintainable and scalable.

### 5. **Testing:**
   - **Unit Testing:** Tools like JUnit for testing the logic of your app.
   - **UI Testing:** Espresso for UI testing, ensuring the user interface works as expected.
   - **Mockito:** For mocking objects in unit tests.

### 6. **Understanding of Android Lifecycle:**
   - **Activity Lifecycle:** Knowing the different stages in an app‚Äôs lifecycle (e.g., `onCreate()`, `onResume()`, etc.).
   - **Fragment Lifecycle:** Managing fragments properly to ensure proper behavior and performance.

### 7. **Knowledge of Databases:**
   - **SQLite:** A lightweight relational database engine used to store data locally in Android apps.
   - **Firebase Firestore/Realtime Database:** For cloud-based real-time databases.

### 8. **Publishing & Distribution:**
   - **Google Play Console:** Understanding how to publish an app to the Google Play Store, including handling app versions, updates, and pricing.
   - **App Signing:** Ensuring the app is securely signed with a private key before uploading to the Play Store.

### 9. **Security:**
   - **Secure Storage:** Knowledge of how to securely store sensitive information such as user data and passwords (e.g., using Android Keystore).
   - **Data Encryption:** Implementing encryption for sensitive data.
   - **Permissions:** Managing and requesting permissions for various device features like camera, location, etc.

### 10. **Additional Skills:**
   - **Understanding of RESTful APIs** for connecting to web services.
   - **Knowledge of GitHub or other Git-based platforms** for collaboration and code management.
   - **Experience with Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)** pipelines to automate testing and deployment.

----------------------------------
IOS Developer requirements:

### 1. **Knowledge and Skills:**
   - **Programming Languages:**
     - **Swift**: The primary language for modern iOS development.
     - **Objective-C**: Older codebases might require familiarity with Objective-C, although Swift is now preferred.
   - **iOS SDK (Software Development Kit)**: Understanding the iOS SDK, which provides the necessary tools and APIs for app development.
   - **Xcode**: The official IDE for iOS development, containing a suite of tools for building, testing, and deploying iOS apps.
   - **Auto Layout**: Essential for building responsive UIs that adapt to different screen sizes and orientations.
   - **UIKit**: The framework for building the user interface in iOS apps.
   - **SwiftUI**: An alternative to UIKit, SwiftUI is a declarative framework for building UIs using Swift.
   
### 2. **Development Tools:**
   - **Xcode**: The integrated development environment (IDE) for iOS development, which includes a code editor, interface builder, simulator, and debugging tools.
   - **CocoaPods** or **Swift Package Manager (SPM)**: Dependency managers for adding third-party libraries or frameworks to your iOS projects.
   - **Simulator**: iOS simulators within Xcode for testing apps without requiring a physical device.
   - **TestFlight**: A platform for distributing beta versions of apps to testers.

### 3. **App Design & User Interface:**
   - **Human Interface Guidelines (HIG)**: Apple‚Äôs design principles that ensure your app follows best practices and provides an excellent user experience.
   - **SwiftUI**: A framework for building modern UIs in a declarative way, which is gaining popularity for new iOS projects.
   - **Storyboards and XIBs**: Legacy UI design tools that still play a role in many iOS projects.

### 4. **Knowledge of iOS Frameworks and Libraries:**
   - **UIKit**: For building and managing interfaces and responding to user interactions.
   - **Core Data**: Apple‚Äôs framework for managing app data and persistence.
   - **Core Animation**: Used for handling animations and transitions.
   - **Core Location**: For accessing the device‚Äôs location data.
   - **Push Notifications (APNs)**: To send notifications to users.
   - **MapKit**: For displaying maps and adding location-based features.
   - **CloudKit**: Apple‚Äôs framework for managing cloud-based data storage.

### 5. **App Architecture:**
   - **MVC (Model-View-Controller)**: The traditional design pattern for iOS apps, though newer patterns like **MVVM (Model-View-ViewModel)** and **VIPER** are gaining traction.
   - **Clean Architecture**: Helps structure your app's codebase for maintainability and scalability.
   - **Combine Framework**: A framework for reactive programming and managing asynchronous events in a declarative way.

### 6. **Testing:**
   - **Unit Testing**: Familiarity with **XCTest** for testing business logic.
   - **UI Testing**: **XCUITest** for automating UI tests to ensure the interface behaves as expected.
   - **Mocking**: Tools like **Cedar** or **OCMock** for mocking objects in unit tests.

### 7. **Understanding of iOS Lifecycle:**
   - **View Controller Lifecycle**: Managing the states of view controllers in the app (e.g., `viewDidLoad()`, `viewWillAppear()`).
   - **App Lifecycle**: Understanding how apps transition between foreground and background states, managing resources, and handling interruptions (e.g., phone calls).

### 8. **App Distribution:**
   - **App Store Connect**: The platform for managing app submissions, updates, and analytics.
   - **App Store Guidelines**: Familiarity with Apple's guidelines for app approval.
   - **Code Signing and Provisioning Profiles**: Essential for building and distributing apps through the App Store or for internal distribution.
   - **TestFlight**: To distribute beta versions of apps and get feedback before releasing the final version.

### 9. **Security:**
   - **Keychain Services**: For storing sensitive information securely, such as passwords or authentication tokens.
   - **Data Encryption**: Knowledge of how to encrypt sensitive data stored locally on the device.
   - **App Transport Security (ATS)**: Understanding of security protocols for ensuring secure network connections.

### 10. **Additional Skills:**
   - **Git and Version Control**: Familiarity with Git for source code management, collaborating with teams, and version control.
   - **Networking (REST APIs)**: Knowledge of how to work with APIs (e.g., JSON, REST) to connect the app to back-end services.
   - **Core Animation and 3D**: For more advanced UI effects and animations.
   - **Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)**: Automating the build, testing, and deployment processes with tools like **Jenkins**, **CircleCI**, or **GitHub Actions**.
   
### 11. **Deployment & Maintenance:**
   - **App Store Review Process**: Understanding the submission and approval process to get your app published.
   - **App Analytics**: Using **Firebase Analytics**, **Mixpanel**, or **Apple Analytics** to track user behavior and app performance.
   - **App Updates**: How to push updates to apps and handle app versioning.

### 12. **Additional Considerations:**
   - **Push Notifications**: Implementing Apple Push Notification Service (APNs) for sending push notifications.
   - **Cloud Storage**: Using Apple‚Äôs **CloudKit** or third-party services (e.g., Firebase, AWS) for cloud storage.
   - **SwiftUI** vs. UIKit: Deciding whether to use the traditional UIKit or newer SwiftUI depending on project requirements.
   - **App Monetization**: Knowledge of monetization techniques like in-app purchases, subscriptions, or ads (e.g., using AdMob or iAd).

### 13. **Keeping Up-to-Date:**
   - **Apple Developer Program**: Access to documentation, beta software, and other resources.
   - **WWDC (Apple Worldwide Developers Conference)**: Attending (or following) the annual conference for new updates on iOS development and platform changes.

title: iOS/Android Mobile App Developer for Oracle MVP
description:
Compensation: Negotiable based on experience
Project Duration: Short-term (MVP Development), potential for long-term engagement

About the Project

The mobile app "Oracle" is a voice-based AI guide designed to be a deeply personalized companion for users, offering mentorship, support, and insights based on contextual understanding. This MVP will be built using Cursor and OpenAI‚Äôs APIs to enable voice-based interaction, adaptive responses, and smart monetization features.

We are looking for a skilled AI Developer with experience in OpenAI API integration, voice-to-text processing, conversational AI, and frontend development to build the leanest possible version of this product while maintaining high engagement and user experience.

Responsibilities

Develop and integrate OpenAI Whisper API for speech-to-text conversion (voice input processing).

Implement GPT-4 API for context-aware, adaptive conversational AI logic.

Utilize OpenAI TTS API for text-to-speech responses to create a fully voice-based experience.

Implement short-term session memory within GPT-4‚Äôs context window to allow fluid, human-like conversations.

Design a smart paywall that triggers after the Oracle completes its initial discovery phase (~5 minutes of conversation).

Integrate Stripe or RevenueCat API for subscription-based monetization.

Develop a lightweight frontend using React/Next.js in Cursor to facilitate interactions.

Optimize the AI system for low-latency, high-quality responses.

Required Skills & Experience

AI & Backend Development

Strong experience with OpenAI APIs (Whisper, GPT-4, TTS).

Knowledge of AI-driven conversational models and contextual adaptation.

Ability to fine-tune system prompts and API calls for optimal performance.

Frontend & UI Development

Proficiency in React/Next.js (required for Cursor-based development).

Experience building clean, minimal UIs for AI-powered applications.

Understanding of voice interaction UX and how to design for seamless conversations.

Payments & Monetization

Experience integrating Stripe or RevenueCat for subscriptions/paywalls.

Understanding of user retention & engagement tactics related to paywalls.

General Requirements

Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work autonomously.

Prior experience building AI-driven applications.

Ability to communicate technical concepts clearly.

Familiarity with Cursor as a development environment (preferred but not required).

Nice-to-Have Skills

Experience in AI fine-tuning and persistent memory systems.

Background in chatbot development, NLP, or voice AI.

Knowledge of gamification mechanics to enhance engagement.

Why Join Us?

Exciting AI-first project at the intersection of personalization, voice AI, and self-improvement.

Opportunity to build an innovative, high-engagement product from the ground up.

Flexible, remote work with a fast-moving startup mindset.

Potential for long-term collaboration as we scale beyond the MVP.

How to Apply

If you're passionate about building intelligent, voice-driven AI applications and want to be part of a project that helps users gain deeper self-awareness, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Please send:

A message explaining why you‚Äôre a great fit.
+
Expected timeline & availability.

Let's build something groundbreaking together! üöÄ

title: React Native Features
description:
The app is a trip creation app and the codebase is clean and easy to work with, I can show you before you give an answer. These are the two features/bugs we need:
1. To coincide with the Privacy, when someone adds you to a trip, even if you are already their friend on VacayCraze, before you can just be added you still HAVE to accept that trip (aka: if Tanner adds Antonino to a trip, Antonino would have to login and accept the trip request from within his notifications bell on the home screen). This will stop celebrities or influencers from being added to a bunch of crazy peoples trips without any say.
2. Melissa created a trip and added Brad, he did not get notified that he was added to the trip and did not get an option to accept or deny being added. This also occurs when Brad adds Melissa to a trip. Someone should be notified when a trip is created and have the option to accept/deny (we have a notification backend api but not an accept/deny feature)

üìå Project Overview
- We are developing an educational AR experience where users scan physical cards to access interactive 3D content via a web browser. The AR system must be WebAR-based, allowing users to engage with dynamic visual content without requiring app installation.

üéØ Key Features

- Informational Overlays: Pop-ups with additional content (text and/or audio).

- WebAR Frameworks: 8th Wall, Three.js, A-Frame, or Unity WebXR.

title: Environment set for Android and IOS
description:
Create Environments for IOS and Android in my PC and cloud with sample code with CI/CD as well.

Development (Dev) Environment: Local development(Runs on Windows Laptop).

Testing (QA/Staging): Testing new features before release(Runs on a cloud server or local VM)

Production (Prod): Live environment for real users(Runs on AWS/GCP/Digitalocean)

üìå A. Development (Local Setup on Windows)
‚úÖ Run Flutter app locally for development
‚úÖ Run Spring Boot APIs on your Windows laptop
‚úÖ Use PostgreSQL locally for database development
‚úÖ Use Firebase for authentication & push notifications

Install the Required Development Tools on Windows

1) Flutter SDK:Android & iOS frontend development
2) Android Studio: Android Emulator & Debugging.
3) VS Code / IntelliJ IDEA : Code Editor for Flutter & Backend.
4) Java JDK 17+: Required for Spring Boot
5) PostgreSQL: Local database setup.
6) Redis: Caching & Session Storage
7) Docker (Optional): Virtualized backend environment
8) Git (Version Control): Managing codebase
9) Postman: API Testing

üìå B. Testing Environment (QA/Staging)
‚úÖ Used by testers to find bugs before release
‚úÖ Runs in a separate cloud or local VM
‚úÖ Separate database to prevent data corruption

üìå How to Set Up the Testing Environment
1) Host on a free cloud service like Render.com or Railway.app
2) Use a separate PostgreSQL instance for testing
3) Run API on a different port.

üìå C. Production Environment (Live Users)
‚úÖ Hosted on AWS/GCP/DigitalOcean
‚úÖ Uses PostgreSQL with backup & scaling
‚úÖ SSL Secured API Server

üìå Steps to Deploy Production
1Ô∏è‚É£ Deploy Backend to AWS/GCP

title: Development of a Shopping App to Centralize Small and Large Businesses
description:
Proposal Request: Development of a Comprehensive Shopping Application

Objective
The goal is to create an all-in-one shopping application where users can explore and purchase products from diverse categories such as clothing, jewelry, technology, and more. This platform will empower small businesses by giving them equal visibility alongside larger brands, fostering inclusivity and accessibility.

Key Features and Requirements

User Features
1. User Registration and Profiles:  
   - Easy account creation via email, phone number, or social media.  
   - User profiles to manage preferences, orders, and wishlists.  

2. Product Catalog:  
   - A diverse product listing categorized into sections (e.g., Clothing, Jewelry, Technology, etc.).  
   - Advanced search and filter options.  
   - Detailed product pages with descriptions, images, reviews, and ratings.  

3. Shopping Experience:  
   - Seamless cart and checkout process.  
   - Secure payment gateway integration (credit cards, PayPal, etc.).  
   - Order tracking and history.  

4. Notifications:  
   - Alerts for sales, promotions, and order updates.  

5. Customer Support:  
   - Integrated chat or help center for user queries.  

Vendor Features
1. Vendor Registration:  
   - Simple onboarding process for small and large businesses.  
   - Vendor dashboards to manage product listings, sales, and inventory.  

2. Business Analytics:  
   - Reports on sales performance and customer engagement.  

3. Product Management:  
   - Tools for uploading product images, descriptions, and pricing.  

Admin Features  
1. Admin Dashboard:  
   - Oversee vendors, users, and transactions.  
   - Monitor and approve vendor registrations.  

2. Analytics and Reports:  
   - Insights into overall platform performance.  

3. Moderation Tools:  
   - Manage product listings, user reviews, and disputes.  

Additional Technical Requirements  
1. Platforms: iOS, Android, and Web Application.  
2. Scalability: Built to handle high user traffic and transactions.  
3. Security: Compliance with data protection standards (e.g., GDPR, PCI DSS).  

Expected Timeline  
I would like to launch the application within 3 to 5 months, with a detailed roadmap including milestones for design, development, testing, and deployment.  

Next Steps  
Please provide the following in your response:  
1. A detailed proposal outlining your approach to the project, including timelines and deliverables.  
2. A portfolio of similar projects you have completed.  
3. Any additional recommendations to enhance the application.

title: React Native Taxi Booking App ‚Äì Full-Stack Development (Fixed Price)
description:
Description:
We are looking for an experienced React Native developer (or team) to build a Taxi Booking App (similar to Uber or Lyft) with both customer and driver functionalities. The app should have a scalable backend to handle real-time bookings, GPS tracking, and payments.

Scope of Work:

Separate login for Customers & Drivers (role-based access).
Cross-platform compatibility (iOS & Android).
Modern UI/UX with smooth navigation.
Real-time location tracking using Google Maps API or Mapbox.
Ride request, driver acceptance, and trip status updates.
Push notifications, SMS verification, and in-app chat.
Secure payment gateway integration (Stripe, PayPal, etc.).
Ratings & Reviews system for both drivers and riders.

2. Backend Development
Tech Stack: Node.js (Express/NestJS) / Django (Python) / Laravel (PHP).

Database: PostgreSQL / MongoDB / MySQL.
Authentication: JWT / OAuth-based authentication.

Real-time booking system using Socket.IO / Firebase.
Admin panel for managing users, earnings reports, and ride history.

Promo codes & referral system.

title: Arabic Funeral Services App - Android, iOS & Web Development
description:
Project Title:
‚ÄúSeeking an Expert Arabic-Speaking Developer for a Funeral Services App Targeting Saudi Arabia‚Äù
________________________________________
Project Overview:
We are looking for a highly skilled Arabic-speaking developer to develop a funeral services mobile application targeting users in Saudi Arabia. The application will be available in Arabic, English, and Urdu, ensuring accessibility for both locals and expatriates.
The project includes a mobile app for iOS & Android along with a web-based admin panel for management.
________________________________________
Key Features
Mobile App (Android & iOS)
- Arabic UI with full English & Urdu language support.
- Focused on Saudi Arabia, with funeral listings categorized by region & city.
- User Registration via OTP authentication (Phone number & email).
- Funeral Management ‚Äì users can register funeral details (deceased info, prayer location, burial time).
- Push Notifications ‚Äì users receive instant alerts for funeral prayer times & burials.
- Google Maps API Integration ‚Äì locate mosques, cemeteries, and service providers in Saudi Arabia.
- Advanced Search System ‚Äì search funerals by location, mosque, cemetery, or name.
- Condolences System ‚Äì users can send pre-written condolence messages in Arabic, English, and Urdu.
- Service Providers Directory ‚Äì mortuary workers, grave diggers, and transport providers can register their services.
- Paid Advertisements System ‚Äì service providers can promote their services.
Web-Based Admin Panel
- Admin dashboard in Arabic for managing funerals & user data.
- Manage funeral-related advertisements.
- Send real-time notifications to users about upcoming funerals.
- View reports & analytics on funerals across Saudi Arabia.
- Role-Based Access Control ‚Äì Super Admin, Mosque Managers, Service Providers.
________________________________________
Required Technical Skills:
- Mobile App Development: Flutter or React Native.
- Web Development: React.js or Vue.js.
- Backend Development: Node.js (Express) or Django (Python).
- Database Management: PostgreSQL or MongoDB.
- Google Maps API for geolocation services.
- Push Notification System (Firebase or OneSignal).
- OTP-based authentication integrated with Saudi Nafath (ŸÜŸÅÿßÿ∞) system.
________________________________________
Contract Type & Development Timeline:
- Fixed-Price Contract with Milestone-based payments.
- Estimated Timeline: 3 months, with an MVP launch within 1 month.
________________________________________
Budget:
- 1500 US$ (negotiable based on expertise and proposal quality).
________________________________________
Application Requirements:
- Portfolio of relevant Arabic-based or service-based apps.
- Technical breakdown on development strategy.
- Estimated timeline for each phase.
- Fluency in Arabic (Mandatory) for smooth communication.
üî¥ Non-Arabic-speaking applicants will NOT be considered due to language requirements.
________________________________________
Final Goal:
To create a modern, Arabic-focused funeral services application for Saudi Arabia, helping communities digitally manage funeral services with ease.

title: Changes in Some Features of an E-Commerce App
description:
We have an existing e-commerce app built with Flutter and need modifications to some features. The app is functional, but we want to make improvements for a better user experience.  

**Requirements:**  
- Modify existing UI elements for better usability.  
- Improve the product filtering and search functionality.  
- Fix minor bugs in the checkout process.  
- Optimize API calls for better performance.  

Looking for an experienced Flutter developer who can quickly understand the codebase and implement these changes efficiently. If the collaboration goes well, there may be more work in the future.  

Let me know your experience and estimated time for completion.m

title: iOS & Android App Developer Needed
description:
We are looking for an experienced iOS and Android app developer to build a Publisher App that provides users with:

‚úÖ A mini-dashboard with key metrics
‚úÖ Link creation and management
‚úÖ Communication through tickets

The app will retrieve data via API, and we will provide all necessary API endpoints for seamless integration. The app will only be available when the user is online.

Key Requirements:

- Experience in iOS (Swift) and Android (Kotlin or Flutter/React Native)
- API integration skills (RESTful API, authentication, data retrieval)
- User authentication via email/login and third-party services**
- Push notifications setup
- Clean and scalable code following best practices
- Ability to implement UI/UX designs (provided in Figma)
- Familiarity with DTAP environments (Development, Testing, Acceptance, Production)

Core Features to Implement:

üìå Authentication & Login (email/third-party login, credential auto-fill, first-time setup prompts)
üìå Navigation & UI Components (hamburger menu, sidebar, date picker, notifications, modals)
üìå Dashboard (Revenue & Engagement metrics, transactions, charts, customizable panels)
üìå Transactions List (Infinite scrolling, filters, campaign details, statuses)
üìå Link Management (Generate new links, link history, campaigns)
üìå Ticketing System (Creating, managing, and responding to support tickets)
üìå Push Notifications (For transactions, messages, campaign updates)

Additional Notes:

- We will provide the API and endpoints for integration
- Designs & prototypes are available in Figma
- The app will utilize the Nexus Nested Design System
- The Dazzle icon pack will be used and needs to be purchased for legal use
- More detailed information will be shared after signing an NDA

Timeline & Budget:

‚è≥ Deadline: 2-3 weeks
üí∞ Budget: Open to proposals, competitive pricing expected

Required Application Materials:

To be considered for this project, please provide:
‚úî Proof of skills and knowledge (e.g., GitHub, code samples, technical assessments)
‚úî References from previous clients or employers
‚úî Examples of apps you have developed (App Store / Play Store links preferred)
‚úî Estimated timeline & cost breakdown
‚úî Tech stack proposal (Swift/Kotlin vs. Flutter/React Native)

üöÄ Future Opportunities: If this project is successfully completed, there will be at least two more app development projects offered. We are looking for a reliable developer / Agency to establish a long-term collaboration.

Looking forward to working together to bring this project to life! üöÄ

title: Flutter Mobile Developer for Alarm/Notification App
description:
We are seeking a skilled mobile developer proficient in Flutter to create an alarm or notification system. The ideal candidate will develop a solution that alerts users when a new ticket is added to the ticketing board, enhancing user engagement. Additionally, the app will include a ticket list feature, allowing users to view all available tickets in a list format. Users should also be able to tap on any ticket to access the ticket detail view, where they can see more information about the specific ticket, such as its description, status, and other relevant details.

Your expertise in integrating notifications and creating intuitive user interfaces will be essential. If you are passionate about building impactful mobile applications and have experience with ticketing systems, we would love to hear from you.

Other detail:
Login: Microsoft Azure SSO
Ticketing System: ConnectWise Manage

title: Development of a Multi-Platform Home Services Booking App (Android, iOS, Web)
description:
Project Overview:
We are looking for a skilled development team to design and build a multi-platform home services application that will connect clients with service providers. The app will be available on Android, iOS, and Web and will support English and Arabic languages.
The platform will facilitate service bookings, provider subscriptions, and online payments while offering a smooth and intuitive user experience. The project includes a mobile app for clients, a mobile app for service providers, and a web-based admin panel to manage the platform.
Key Features:
1. User Categories
‚Ä¢ Clients: Individuals looking for home services.
‚Ä¢ Service Providers: Professionals offering services such as:
o Car Repair, Car Electricity & Battery, Car Rental
o Barbery & Beauty Services
o House Plumbing, Electricity, AC Repair & Services
o Nursery & Childcare Services
o House Cleaning Services
o Home freight services & Property Rental
2. Registration & Authentication
‚Ä¢ Clients: Register using name and mobile number, login via SMS activation code (OTP).
‚Ä¢ Service Providers: Register with company details (CEO name, CR number, address, phone, etc.) and pay a subscription fee (monthly, quarterly, semi-annual, annual).
‚Ä¢ Admin Panel: Manage and approve/reject provider registrations.
3. Booking & Payment System
‚Ä¢ Clients can browse and book services through the app.
‚Ä¢ Sending Message for communication between clients and service providers.
‚Ä¢ Service providers receive real-time notifications for new orders.
‚Ä¢ Clients can pay online via payment gateway (credit/debit cards, bank transfers) or pay locally in cash.
‚Ä¢ Payment management for service provider subscriptions.
4. Admin Panel (Web-Based)
‚Ä¢ User Management: Approve/reject service providers.
‚Ä¢ Payments & Fees: Adjust subscription fees, monitor transactions.
‚Ä¢ Service Demand Tracking: Insights into popular services.
‚Ä¢ Financial Reports: Track revenue, subscriptions, and transactions.
‚Ä¢ Notifications: Send system-wide announcements.
5. Location-Based Service Sorting
‚Ä¢ Clients will see services sorted by proximity using GPS.
‚Ä¢ Service providers must enable location access for proper listings.
6. Ratings & Reviews
‚Ä¢ Clients can rate & review service providers.
‚Ä¢ Reviews will be displayed on provider profiles.
7. Notifications & Reminders
‚Ä¢ Push notifications, SMS, and email alerts for bookings, payments, and updates.
‚Ä¢ Subscription reminders for service providers.
8. AI-Based Recommendations (Optional Feature)
‚Ä¢ AI can suggest service providers based on user history and location.
‚Ä¢ Open to developer recommendations for AI features.
9. Multi-Language Support
‚Ä¢ The app must support English & Arabic (UI should allow easy language switching).
Technology Preferences:
We are open to cost-effective yet high-performance technologies. You may suggest:
‚Ä¢ Mobile App: Native (Swift/Kotlin) or Cross-Platform (Flutter/React Native).
‚Ä¢ Web App & Admin Panel: React.js, Angular, or any recommended framework.
‚Ä¢ Backend & Database: Node.js, Django, Laravel, Firebase, or any scalable solution.
‚Ä¢ Payment Gateway: Integration with Stripe, PayPal, or local banks.
Project Scope & Deliverables:
1. Android & iOS apps for Clients and Service Providers.
2. Web-based admin panel for platform management.
3. Backend development with secure APIs and database.
4. Multilingual UI (English & Arabic).
5. Testing & Bug Fixing before launch.
6. Deployment to Google Play, Apple App Store, and Web Hosting.
Budget & Timeline:
‚Ä¢ Budget: Open for proposals, looking for cost-effective solutions.
‚Ä¢ Timeline: Expected 3-4 months for full development.
Preferred Experience:
‚Ä¢ Experience in service marketplace apps.
‚Ä¢ Expertise in Android, iOS, and Web development.
‚Ä¢ Strong UI/UX design skills for multi-platform consistency.
‚Ä¢ Experience integrating payment gateways & location-based services.
How to Apply:
Interested developers should submit:
‚Ä¢ Portfolio of similar apps developed.
‚Ä¢ Tech stack proposal and development approach.
‚Ä¢ Estimated timeline & cost breakdown.
‚Ä¢ Any additional recommendations or improvements to the project.

title: Game App Development - Car Racing Game (Unlimited Loop) for Kids (9-10 years old)
description:
I am looking for an experienced app developer to create a simple yet engaging car racing game for mobile, aimed primarily at kids aged 9-10 years old. The core objective of this app is to create a fun and addictive experience while incorporating a monetization strategy through ads. The game should feature an unlimited road loop and increase in speed to keep players engaged, with obstacles that slow down the car.

Game Requirements:
Core Gameplay: A car racing game where the player drives a car on an infinite road loop.
Speed Mechanics: The speed of the car should gradually increase from 1 to 2 km, adding to the challenge as the game progresses.
Bumper Obstacles: There will be bumpers or obstacles that reduce the speed of the car when hit.
Endless Loop: The game continues indefinitely, offering endless playtime and keeping players engaged.
Simple UI: Clean, colorful, and child-friendly design with basic controls that are easy for kids to understand.
Target Audience: The game should be designed for kids aged 9-10 years old with age-appropriate graphics and difficulty level.
Monetization through Ads: The primary motive for creating this game is to run ads, so the app should support ad integrations (e.g., interstitial ads or banners) for monetization.

Milestones & Payment:
The development process will be divided into two milestones with the following payment structure:

+First Milestone (20%): At the end of the first phase, which includes the initial version of the game (basic mechanics, game flow, and initial ad integration).
+Second Milestone (80%): Upon the final delivery of the game (full app functionality, tested, and ready for deployment on app stores).

Timeline:
Project Duration: The app should be completed and fully functional within 3 months.

Additional Notes:
Testing: You will be responsible for thoroughly testing the game and fixing any bugs.
Budget: The budget is tight, so efficiency and cost-effectiveness are crucial.
Communication: Regular updates on progress are expected throughout the development process.
Ad Integration: The app's monetization through ads is a key priority, so ads should be integrated seamlessly.

If you're confident in your ability to handle this project from start to finish, including development, testing, and ensuring monetization through ads, and can create a child-friendly game experience, I'd love to hear from you!
skills: ['UX & UI', 'Android App Development', 'Android', 'In-App Purchases', 'Mobile App Design', 'iOS', 'Mobile App Development', 'Flutter']

title: Full-Stack Developer Needed for Telehealth Therapy Platform and Mobile App
description:
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Full-Stack Developer or a Team of Developers to design and build a telehealth therapy platform and app that will be accessible on both browsers (web-based) and mobile devices (iOS and Android). This platform will provide a seamless and secure solution for connecting patients and providers while meeting HIPAA compliance requirements. The goal is to create an easy-to-use, intuitive platform that serves underserved populations, including those with limited access to technology.
Key Features and Requirements:
General Features:
Cross-Platform Compatibility:
The platform must work on desktop browsers, as well as on iOS and Android devices.
User-Friendly Interface:
A simple and intuitive design with minimal buttons and navigation to accommodate users with low technical literacy.
HIPAA Compliance:
Ensure all data handling, storage, and communication meet HIPAA privacy and security standards.
Dashboards:
Doctor‚Äôs Dashboard:
View and manage patient sessions.
Access Electronic Health Records (EHR).
Conduct live video chat and text chat with patients.
Add notes after sessions.
Manage prescriptions and referrals.
Patient‚Äôs Dashboard:
Easy login with name and date of birth (no traditional usernames/passwords to ease access for users with limited technology skills).
Access to live video chat and text chat with therapists.
Ability to view therapy session schedules and receive automatic reminders.
Option to fill out a questionnaire form to determine their needs and get matched with the right provider.
Prescription section to view medications and instructions.
Admin Dashboard:
Manage doctor and patient accounts.
Monitor system activity and logs.
Oversee onboarding and billing processes.
View and manage insurance billing, including Medicaid claims.
Specific Features:
Live Video Chat and Text Chat:
Secure and reliable communication tools between patients and providers.
Questionnaire Form:
A form for patients to fill out during onboarding to identify their mental health needs and automatically suggest or assign a provider.
Electronic Health Records (EHR):
Secure storage and management of patient records, including session notes, prescriptions, and medical history.
Easy Login:
Allow patients to log in with just their name and date of birth to reduce barriers for those who may forget login credentials or have limited tech access.
Insurance Integration:
Onboarding process to identify if the patient has Medicaid or other insurance that allows them to access therapy services at no cost.
Session Reminders:
Automatic reminders sent to patients via text or email for scheduled therapy sessions.
Prescription Management:
A section where doctors can manage prescriptions and patients can view or request refills.
Responsibilities:
Design and develop the web and mobile app platforms with the features listed above.
Ensure seamless synchronization between web and mobile apps.
Implement secure video and text chat functionalities.
Develop and integrate a secure EHR system.
Build a questionnaire system for patient intake and matching.
Create a simple and intuitive UI/UX for all dashboards (patients, doctors, and admin).
Ensure HIPAA compliance across all aspects of the platform.
Set up automatic reminders for therapy sessions and prescription notifications.
Integrate an insurance billing system, prioritizing Medicaid.
Test and debug the platform to ensure it runs smoothly across all devices.
Provide documentation and training on the platform‚Äôs use.
Qualifications:
Proven experience in building telehealth platforms, healthcare apps, or similar projects.
Strong knowledge of HIPAA compliance requirements and secure data handling.
Expertise in frontend and backend development (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js, Node.js, Python, etc.).
Experience with cross-platform mobile app development (e.g., Flutter, React Native).
Familiarity with secure live video APIs (e.g., Twilio, Zoom SDK, or WebRTC).
Experience implementing EHR systems or integrating them with third-party solutions.
Strong UI/UX design skills focused on simplicity and accessibility.
Background in insurance billing systems (Medicaid and other insurers).
Excellent communication skills and ability to work collaboratively.
Deliverables:
Fully functional web and mobile app platforms with the specified features.
Documentation of the development process and system architecture.
Training session or guide for platform admins.
Ongoing support for a pre-agreed period after launch to handle any bugs or issues.
Timeline:
We are aiming to have the platform launched within X months (adjustable based on your estimate), with regular progress updates and milestones.
Budget:
Please provide a detailed quote for the project, including:
Development costs.
Any third-party API or integration fees.
Support and maintenance costs.
How to Apply:
If you are interested in this project, please submit:
Your portfolio or examples of similar projects you‚Äôve worked on.
A brief proposal outlining your approach to building this platform.
Your estimated timeline and budget.
Any questions or clarifications you have about the project.
We look forward to working with you to create a platform that brings critical mental health services to underserved communities.

title: Android Developer Needed for Scraping Google Discover Feed (PoC Development)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Android developer to help us automate the scrolling and capturing of the Google Discover feed on an Android device. This Proof of Concept (PoC) aims to determine the feasibility of screen recording or screenshot-based scraping while automating the scrolling process.

The solution should be designed for one specific Android device but should be scalable and adaptable if applied to another device in the future.

Possible Solution:

Project Scope:
The goal is to develop an application or service that can:
- Open the Google Discover feed.
- Scroll through the Google Discover feed programmatically.
- Capture the scrolling feed via screen recording or periodic screenshots.
- Ensure the approach can be scaled to work on other Android devices with minimal adjustments.

Ideal Candidate:
- Experience with Android automation (UIAutomator, Accessibility Services, MediaProjection API).

I‚Äôm looking for a developer (or team) to build a social crowd-sharing mobile app that helps users find, review, and share halal restaurants and caf√©s. Users should be able to post photos/videos, rate experiences, vote on halal elements, and filter locations based on these factors.

The app will be similar to Yelp and later have Instagram like elements. It will have Google Maps integration and AI-based content moderation.

üëâ This is a work-for-hire project ‚Äì you will be required to sign an NDA (Non-Disclosure Agreement) before beginning work, and all intellectual property, code, and assets will be fully owned by me upon completion.

üìå Key Features & Requirements
‚úÖ User Features:

Login & Authentication (Google & Facebook integration)
Post photos & short videos with captions
Comment, rate & review restaurants

Admin & Backend Requirements:

User roles: Standard users & ‚Äúsuperusers‚Äù for more moderation power
Database for storing restaurant data & user-generated content
Ability to auto-import an initial list of halal restaurants/caf√©s using:
Google Places API (preferred)
OpenStreetMap (OSM) or public halal certification websites

üöÄ Payments will be milestone-based and released only after successful delivery & approval of each phase.

üìå Ideal Developer Skills
üîπ Experience with no-code/low-code platforms (if applicable) OR mobile app development using Flutter, React Native, or Swift/Kotlin
üîπ Experience with Google Places API & Maps integration
üîπ AI-based content moderation (preferred but not required)
üîπ Familiar with Firebase or backend solutions for authentication & database management

‚è≥ Next Steps
1Ô∏è‚É£ Let me see your portfolio or past projects (especially if you've built review-based apps).

title: 2 FlutterFlow Web Pages, Invoice and Estimate
description:
Build 2 web pages using FlutterFlow, one for an Invoice and one for an Estimate, along with some integration modifications to the current FlutterFlow app (iOS and Android).

Both pages require modification of the existing Flutter initiation from within the FlutterFlow app when a button "Send" is clicked.  This opens the user's SMS interface with a message and a link to the we based document (either Estimate or Invoice).  

Estimate: When the recipient clicks on the link, they see an estimate for services (like plumbing or painting) and can hit an Approve button.  This gets saved to the Firebase database.

Invoice: When the recipient clicks on the link, they see an invoice for services (like plumbing or painting) and can hit one of the payment buttons.  The first release will start with simple integration for the following: Venmo, PayPal and Zelle.  When the user clicks on any of these, it will open up the payment app in question with 3 pieces of information: the receiving person's identification, the amount and a description (which contains the invoice ID concatenated with the textual description of the project).

This should be a relatively simple project for anyone with solid FlutterFlow experience, taking just a few days.  If you think it will take you weeks, you wouldn't be a good fit for this project.

title: Mobile App Developer Needed for Smart Home & Utility Management Ap
description:
We are looking for an experienced front-end mobile app developer to build a smart home and utility management app for iOS and Android. The app will be template-based, dynamically populated using a JSON API response, which will determine the appropriate template and data.

Project Overview:
The app will be built using approximately 15 page templates.
Utilize approximately 30 JSON API calls
Features include location-based services, OAuth authentication, two-factor authentication (2FA), Google Maps integration, and data visualization (bar and pie charts).
We will provide all API documentation and JSON responses required for integration.
The project will be developed in four phases:
Project Phases:
Phase 1: Design and develop the UI for the first five page templates.
Phase 2: Integrate these five templates with the JSON API.
Phase 3: Design and develop the remaining 15 templates.
Phase 4: Final testing and submission to the App Store & Google Play.

Requirements:
Proficiency in React Native, Flutter, or native Swift (iOS) & Kotlin (Android).
Experience implementing modern UI/UX based on provided wireframes.
Strong understanding of RESTful API integration and JSON parsing.
Experience with OAuth and 2FA authentication.
Ability to integrate Google Maps and data visualizations (charts/graphs).
Familiarity with App Store & Play Store submission processes.
Ideal Candidate:
Proven experience developing high-performance mobile apps.
Strong UI/UX skills with attention to detail.
Experience with state management (Redux, Provider, Riverpod, etc.).
Ability to optimize app performance and ensure smooth UI interactions.
Deliverables:
Phase 1: UI designs for the first five templates.
Phase 2: API-integrated version of these five templates.
Phase 3: Completion of all remaining templates.
Phase 4: Submission to the App Store & Google Play.

Attached is a design of the various page templates to be created.   API JSON documentation will be provided after award unless you have any specific questions.

If you're interested, please apply with:

Examples of past mobile app projects.
Your preferred development framework (React Native, Flutter, or Native).
Your estimated timeline for each phase.
We look forward to working with a talented developer to bring this project to life!

Developers contacting us outside this app by any other method will be disqualified.
